attributes.action: Increase school funding and introduce curriculum change to reduce knife crime.
attributes.additional_details: After school activities are essential in providing a safe space for children to develop social skills, which reduces aggression in the immediate and long term future. It also allows for them to have a supportive environment, which is evidenced to reduce knife carrying. Mentors are necessary for children to have a positive role model. Finally, knife crime intervention needs to be mandatory in the school curriculum as it will increase children's understanding, thus, leading to reduced knife crime.
attributes.background:
This petition demands an increase in funding for schools across the country, which is vital to allow them to run more after school activities and fund peer mentors. 
Also, for a change in curriculum, to include knife crime intervention as mandatory, and to allow for guest speakers on the topic.

rejection.details:
We believe we already have petitions open which cover the issues you have raised, which you might like to sign:

Make knife crime prevention a compulsory requirement for all school curriculum
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/634860

Increased funding to improve public schools
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/637330
